title: @any rioter Ashe rework please respond back
body:
It said other little changes. Did that mean taking away her slow and stun and e with passive gold or keeping her stuff the same just increasing her basic stats and will her passive be better for her?Please respond thank you,
YogiMC1

replies.body:
Pretty small changes overall. So, you know, we're just going to turn her into a melee range, male tank that hits people with clubs made of ashen wood he holds in each hand. And he'll be from Shurima of course.

Bad jokes aside we're not looking to change the core of Ashe. Same slow on auto attacks, same global stun ult, same long attack range etc. Changes are focused primarily on making her passive and Q a bit more engaging, consistently relevant. In terms of scale think roughly along the lines of the recent Zilean changes or the Viktor changes from a few months back.

Are there going to be any changes you think will make her more healthy in a competitive scene? I know her lack of escapes right now really cripples her making her... To put this bluntly... preeeetty shit in higher elos

honestly, the only thing keeping ashe from seeing competitive play is {{item:3222}} mikael's. Before this item became a staple of competitive play, C9 brought ashe out to great success with their ashe zyra combo.

Well, that, and a whole bunch of other adc's got some pretty nice buffs as well.
That's awesome! I'm glad someone brought that to my attention, as I've got a lot of love for Ashe and reaaallly enjoy playing her

she does take more skill to play successfully tho, since she doesn't have a "get out of jail free" skill that most popular adc's have. Also, most successful ashes don't get very many kills, rather, they have far more assists than most adc's. Which may be another reason for her current unpopularity. Kills are satisfying, and not getting kills on a role who's job is to do dmg feels kinda lousy.

Hence why Ashe is commonly termed a "utility ADC".  Her damage is outstripped by most other marksmen, but she brings a ton of usefulness to the teamfight with her hard/soft cc and vision.

And a competent Ashe player is an absolute nightmare to lane against.  W's cooldown is very low even at low ranks, giving her very good waveclear early on.
Yeah. Ashe got my my first and most recent penta kill ^^
does this mean yer changing ashe's q from a toggle to an aa reset that causes her next aa to do bonus dmg + a slow?
how'd you come to that conclusion, based on what Meddler said?

yeah. Think about it, how can you make a toggle slow "more engaging"? By not making it a toggle, giving it a 3-6 sec cd, and compensate it by giving it bonus dmg and/or a more potent/longer lasting slow. Allowing it to act as an aa reset will also give ashe that pseudo aa steroid she needs to stay relevant in the modern world of adc's without sacrificing what is truly unique about her.

As for the passive, I really don't have a clue what they've got planned for it.

I was just saying that you had a very specific change from an otherwise pretty vague comment that Meddler gave, I wasn't sure if you were just speculating or if you had other information. There is more than one way to make her Q "more engaging, consistently relevant"
well, I *did* phrase it as a question. There are a billion ways to do things, it's just that's what popped into my head first that fit the criteria.

Hopefully, you guys aren't going to  break her with her new passive/changes. As an Ashe player, I don't need Ashe to be op. She's fine now, except that she doesn't have reasons to be picked over other adcs. It would be awesome if this change creates a reason to pick Ashe over Varus, Kog, Darius, etc.

I mean, thanks Riot for even considering this. I never knew a day would actually come when Ashe's passive was gonna be reworked. :'D

Isn't Ashe's passive kinda a waste when you get full crit?

EDIT: Will you do anything to tackle that problem like for example: Have her crit dmg increased when she gets full crit or something?
What about her E? Can you put a more interactively passive in here, the free gold is good but she can have some better, maybe the part of crit can fit in here.

Idea I had for "Focus" shortly after Kalista's release, since she opened up the potential for modified basic commands:

*Ashe can extend the wind-up of her basic attacks by keeping the mouse button held whenever she issues an attack command, increasing the damage dealt by up to X (or X-X% based on level). Ashe's attacks will fail if she loses sight of her target or the target moves more than 750 units away while she's winding up her attack.*

* Ashe will fire the attack automatically upon completing the extended wind-up animation - it is not required to release the mouse button to perform the attack, but releasing it early will complete the attack early.
* Ashe can keep the mouse button held to continuously perform focused attacks.
